Tangkisan-tangkisan Anies Baswedan Soal Keanehan Anggaran
04 Nov 2019, 07:48 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Beberapa hari terakhir rencana anggaran DKI tahun 2020 menjadi sorotan publik karena ada beberapa anggaran yang dianggap salah atau aneh. Tangkisan-tangkisan pun disampaikan Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan untuk menjelaskan soal keanehan anggaran.
Anggaran-anggaran aneh yang muncul itu di antaranya biaya influencer Rp 5 miliar, jalur sepeda Rp 73 miliar, pengadaan lem aibon Rp 82,8 miliar, hingga anggaran ballpoint di Suku Dinas Pendidikan Wilayah I Jaktim sebesar Rp 124 miliar. Berikut tangkisan-tangkisan Anies soal keanehan anggaran:

1. Sistem Digital tapi Tidak Smart

Anies mengatakan sistem digital yang tidak smart menjadi penyebab adanya keanehan anggaran. Sistem warisan yang mengandalkan manusia itu, kata dia, mengakibatkan adanya masalah penganggaran selama bertahun-tahun.
"Iya, jadi sistemnya sekarang ini sudah digital, but not a smart system. Itu hanya digital aja, mengandalkan orang untuk me-review. Itu sudah berjalan bertahun tahun. Karena itu ini akan diubah, tidak akan dibiarkan begitu saja. Let's do it in a smart way," ucap Anies Baswedan kepada wartawan di Balai Kota DKI Jakarta, Rabu (30/10).
Menurut Anies, sistem yang smart bisa mengoreksi kesalahan memasukkan data. Dengan demikian, kemungkinan munculnya anggaran yang aneh akan bisa dikurangi.
"Kalau smart system dia bisa melakukan pengecekan, verifikasi. Dia bisa menguji. Ini sistem digital tetapi masih mengandalkan manual," ucap Anies.

2. Tak Mungkin Membeli Lem Aibon Rp 82 M

Anies menegaskan tidak mungkin membeli lem Aibon seharga Rp 82,8 miliar seperti dalam rencana Kebijakan Umum Anggaran dan Prioritas Plafon Anggaran Sementara (KUA-PPAS) DKI 2020. Anies sendiri mengaku menemukan beberapa kejanggalan lain dalam rencana anggaran itu.
"Nggak mungkin beli lem Aibon Rp 82 miliar. Saya itu menemukan beli Rotring Rp 35 miliar, ballpoint Rotring. Kemudian ATK Rp 1,6 triliun. Jadi itu sudah kita temukan, itu yang akan koreksi. Dan ini salahnya sistem karena mengandalkan manusia," ucap Anies Baswedan kepada wartawan di Balai Kota DKI Jakarta, Selasa (30/10).

Anies Baswedan's rebuttal about Budget Budget Oddities
Nov 04 2019, 07:48 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - The last few days of the 2020 DKI budget plan have been in the public spotlight because there are some budgets that are considered wrong or strange. DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan also denied the arguments to explain the budget peculiarities.
The strange budgets that appeared include the influencers costs Rp. 5 billion, bicycle paths Rp. 73 billion, procurement of aibon glue Rp. 82.8 billion, to the ballpoint budget in East Jakarta Region I Office of Rp. 124 billion. Here are Anies's challenges about budget oddities:

1. Digital Systems but Not Smart

Anies said that digital systems that are not smart are the cause of budget peculiarities. The legacy system that relies on humans, he said, has resulted in budgeting problems for years.
"Yes, so the system is now digital, but not a smart system. It's only digital, relying on people to review. It has been running for years. Because of this it will be changed, it will not be left alone. Let's do it in a smart way, "Anies Baswedan told reporters at the Jakarta City Hall on Wednesday (10/30).
According to Anies, a smart system can correct errors in entering data. Thus, the possibility of the emergence of a strange budget will be reduced.
"If it's a smart system, it can do checks, verify. It can test. It's a digital system but it still relies on manuals," Anies said.

2. It is impossible to buy Aibon Glue for Rp. 82 billion

Anies asserted that it was impossible to buy Aibon glue for Rp. 82.8 billion as planned in the 2020 2020 Temporary Budget Budget and KUA-PPAS. Anies himself claimed to find several other irregularities in the budget plan.
"It is impossible to buy Aibon glue for Rp. 82 billion. I found a Rp. 35 billion buy Rotring, a Rotring ballpoint. Then an ATK of Rp. 1.6 trillion. So we have found that, that will be a correction. And this is the fault of the system because it relies on humans," Anies Baswedan told reporters at the Jakarta City Hall on Tuesday (10/30).
